IPlayerServices.desc: Specifically playtime, owned games, badges, and Steam level. For player summaries, bans and friend list, go to [ISteamUser](ISteamUser)

GetRecentlyPlayedGames.desc: Get information about games the user has played within the last 2 weeks.

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

count.desc: Number of recently played games to return. Unset or 0 will return all recently played games

games.desc: Array of objects containing information about recently played games

appid.desc: Steam internal app id, always unique

playtime_recent.desc: Game playtime in minutes over the last 2 weeks

url_store.desc: Basic url to store page, url is not canonical (name is not in url)

url_store_header.desc: Basic url to header image for Steam store page, url stays the same but the resulting image can change frequently

url_app_logo.desc: Url to app logo, seems to always be 184x69 pixels and never changes

url_app_icon.desc: Url to app icon, seems to always be 32x32 pixels and never changes

games.name: Call of Duty: World at War

GetOwnedGames.desc:
Retrieve a list of all games the user has ever bought or installed (free-to-play). This list is seemingly not sorted in any way at all. This will likely not match the user's current library, as some may have installed a free-to-play game, never played it, and then uninstalled it. Even then, that free-to-play game will forever be included as an "owned game."

Despite the Web API claiming that free-to-play games are excluded by default, and may be included if specified, this isn't true and free-to-play games will ALWAYS be returned no matter what you try to tell the Web API. Trust me, I tried and `include_played_free_games` does literally nothing. Sadly there is no way to tell if any of the returned games are free-to-play with this API on it's own, so you'll either have to use another API to check, or keep track of all appIDs of free-to-play games. Thanks Volvo...

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

appIDs.desc: Array of integer appIDs (or just one integer, no array necessary) to specifically retrieve, set to null to get all owned games

moreInfo.desc: Set to true to get more info: name, image urls

games.desc: Array of objects containing information about owned games

name.desc: Full name of the game, only returned if `moreInfo` is `true`

appid.desc: Steam internal app id, always unique

playtime_recent.desc: Game playtime in minutes over the last 2 weeks

url_store.desc: Basic url to store page, url is not canonical (name is not in url)

url_store_header.desc: Basic url to header image for Steam store page, url stays the same but the resulting image can change frequently, only returned if `moreInfo` is `true`

url_app_logo.desc: Url to app logo, seems to always be 184x69 pixels and never changes, only returned if `moreInfo` is `true`

url_app_icon.desc: Url to app icon, seems to always be 32x32 pixels and never changes, only returned if `moreInfo` is `true`

GetSteamLevel.desc: Get the current Steam Level of the user, and absolutely nothing more.

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

GetBadges.desc: Get all badges the user currently has, and some detailed level information.

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

xp.desc: Total XP the Steam user has

level_xp.desc: The XP requirement for the user's current Steam level

next_level_xp.desc: The XP requirement for the next Steam level

appid.desc: Steam internal app id, always unique

level.desc: Level of the badge, could be any positive integer, or 0 if only the foil badge was unlocked

earned.desc: Time the badge was initially level 1, in seconds since the epoch, could be 0 if only the foil badge was unlocked

xp.desc: Amount of XP the badge is worth, could be 0 if only the foil badge was unlocked

scarcity.desc: The total number of Steam users with a badge level equal to or higher than this badge level, could be 0 if only the foil badge was unlocked

foil.desc: The foil badge information, could be 0 if the user has not unlocked the foil version. Contains the `level`, `earned`, `xp` and `scarcity` properties

event.desc: Limited time event badges, listed by event tag names. Other than the new `name` property, the badges are identical in structure to game badges

special.desc: Steam specific badges, each with a very unique way of earning/ leveling, listed by tag names. Identical to event badges, but they have no `appid` or `foil` property

GetCommunityBadgeProgress.desc: Returns the badge progress for specific task-based badges.

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

badgeID.desc: Badge ID, could also be the true integer value of the badge ID. Valid values for this are currently `community`, `summer-2012`, `holiday-2012`, `hardware-beta`, `awards-2016`, `awards-2017`, `awards-2018` and `spring-cleaning`.

quests.desc: Object of quests, listed by quest ids

name.desc: Always 'unknown'. This will eventually contain the description of the task once a map is created to connect quest ids to their actual tasks. You can support development of this feature by finding the `quests.json` file inside the `json` directory in the repository code!

completed.desc: Whether or not the task has been completed

count.desc: Number of quests for this badge

completed.desc: Number of completed quests for this badge

ISteamUser.desc: Returns more detailed information about user profiles; summaries, bans, friends. For Steam level, badges, games, and playtime, go to [IPlayerServices](IPlayerServices)

GetFriendList.desc: Gets the friends of the Steam user, if public.

steamID.desc: Steam ID of the user, as a string

sorted.desc: Enable sorting by friending time, with the oldest friends at the top of the resulting list

friends.desc: Array of friend objects, sorted if the `sorted` paramter is `true`

since.desc: Time the friend was added, in seconds since the epoch

GetPlayerBans.desc: Retrieves ban information on the provided Steam IDs. Notice that is PLURAL. You can get information on multiple Steam IDs at once, however Steam may internally limit the max number of Steam IDs you can query at once.

steamIDs.desc: Array of Steam ID strings, or just one, no array necessary

count.desc: Number of returned profiles, useful for checking if any Steam IDs were ignored or cropped from the final result

players.desc: Ban objects listed by Steam ID

community.desc: Whether or not the account has a community ban

economy.desc: What type of economy ban the account has. These are often temporary. Sadly, I don't know the possible values of this. If you have account restrictions, or know someone who does, please reach out to me so I can finish development on this part.

vac.desc: Whether or not the account has a VAC ban. It may be possible for a single account to have multiple VAC bans, but I personally doubt it as VAC normally bans across ALL VAC secure games.

bans.desc: Total number of bans on the account; VAC + Game bans

vacBans.desc: Number of VAC bans on the account

gameBans.desc: Number of Game bans on the account. Game bans are not VAC bans, they are manually given to a player by the developer of the game they got banned on.

lastBan.desc: Number of days since the last ban was given to the account, a value of `0` indicates the account recieved a ban *today*

GetPlayerSummaries.desc: Get basic community profile information from the Steam IDs. Notice that is PLURAL. You can get information on multiple Steam IDs at once, however Steam may internally limit the max number of Steam IDs you can query at once.

steamIDs.desc: Array of Steam ID strings, or just one, no array necessary

count.desc: Number of returned profiles, useful for checking if any Steam IDs were ignored or cropped from the final result

players.desc: Player objects listed by Steam ID

name.desc: Persona name, this is shown in games and on the website

realName.desc: The "real name" set by the account, not guaranteed to actually be real. May be set to Boolean `false` if unset, useful for checking if a string is set before printing it

url.desc: Community profile URL, may contain the Steam ID or be the custom vanity url set by the account

state.desc: A value from 0-6; 0 - Offline, 1 - Online, 2 - Busy, 3 - Away, 4 - Snooze, 5 - Looking to Trade, 6 - Looking to Play

stateString.desc: Mapped value of `state` to a string, see the `persona.json` file in `json` for values

public.desc: Whether or not the profile is visible, if this is false then some interfaces may not work at all, and limited data is available through player summaries

comments.desc: Whether or not the comments are set to public, if this is false then you won't be able to comment on the profile, and may also not be able to see comments

joined.desc: Time the account was created, in seconds since the epoch. This is not available for private accounts, however you can easily use the Steam ID to guess the time the account was created anyway.

offline.desc: Time the account last went offline, in seconds since the epoch. This does not mean the player is currently offline, or when they *actually* went offline, just the last time their status changed to be offline.

community.desc: Whether or not the profile has a community profile set up. You should not allow accounts without a community profile to use your services.

group.desc: The primary group set by the user, if no group is set then this value is a Boolean `false` to avoid ambiguity

inGame.desc: If the user is currently in a game

appid.desc: If `inGame` is true, then this is the app id of the game being played. If `inGame` is true and this value is 0, then the account is playing a non-Steam game.

appName.desc: If `inGame` is true, then this is most likely the name of the game being played. If `appid` is 0, this is the "extra game info" from the non-Steam game, and may not be an accurate representation of the true game name.

avatar.desc: Holds the various urls for the avatar sizes

location.desc: The public location of the account, should never be used for any real location authentication, as users can change this whenever and however they want

country.desc: Full English name of the country, is a Boolean `false` if not set by the account

state.desc: Full English name of the state/ province/ city-state, is a Boolean `false` if not set by the account

city.desc: Full English name of the city, is a Boolean `false` if not set by the account. Keep in mind some country states have only one possible city, and some have no city options at all.

countryCode.desc: The country code for the country, should adhere to world standards (i.e. United States code is `US`)

stateCode.desc: The state code for the state, for some countries this is the official abbreviation (i.e. Alaska state code is `AK`) but for most this is just a random internal code

cityCode.desc: The city code for the city, seems to be a completely unique id, otherwise this is not standardized and only for internal use
